intro: Cymodocea webbiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is native to the Indo-Pacific region and typically grows in shallow coastal waters. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are adapted to underwater environments, and it plays a vital role in stabilizing sediments and supporting marine biodiversity. Cymodocea webbiana is often found in seagrass meadows, which are important habitats for various aquatic species.
